text: New Horizons in Old Havana with tourism
on the rise tens of thousands will visit
the crumbling heart of the Cuban capital
this year especially from the United
States to meet the demand new hotels are
springing up and old ones are being
refurbished certainly one of the two
candidates in the US presidential races
talks a lot of his background in hotel
building the other about hers in
diplomacy but after a year of seismic
change in their relationship with
Washington many Cubans are asking what a
trump or a Clinton presidency will mean
for the Thor in relations for her part
Hillary Clinton has said the Cuba
embargo needs to go once and for all
she's claimed she urged President Obama
towards normalization with Cuba while
Secretary of State but Cubans have
lingering doubts and remember how her
husband tightened restrictions on the
island as for Donald Trump
he said the concept of opening with Cuba
is fine in a recent interview but added
that the US should have made a better
deal he's also written in favor of the
trade embargo in the past
truth be told for most Cubans there's
very little to separate the two
candidates Hillary Clinton of course is
a known quantity and represents some
form of continuity with the Obama
administration but she isn't entirely
trusted in Cuba a conservative
billionaire businessman might seem a
natural enemy to most Cubans unless of
course he can find a way to convince
Congress to lift the embargo with the
u.s. embroiled in one of the most bitter
election campaigns in living memory Cuba
is a low priority for the two candidates
for now but for the diplomats in Havana
November's result is crucial do they
fear that the good work done so far
could be unpicked my wish is that when
the campaign is over and the election is
over and whoever is elected president is
in the White House he or she will
recognize the value
the direction that we have taken and
will wish to continue it
the Cubans to remaining tight-lipped for
the time being when you look at the
polls the majority of the American
population and the Cuban American
community are in favor of the
normalization of relations between human
the United States so I expect that their
opinion will be taking into account in
the future some think as cuba moves its
economy towards tourism it could benefit
from having a hotel businessman in the
White House others here wants something
closer to the Obama administration but a
year after perhaps the most symbolic
moment in Cuba's Thor with Washington
asked many Cubans if they'd prefer a
President Clinton or a president Trump
neither they answer will grant BBC News
Havana
